entry.title: Notenik 4.9.0 Released

summary.p: Improvements in website making, and in iCloud access.

entry.content:
• Added a new File command to create a New Collection in iCloud
  • Added a new Transform command to Stash Notes in a subfolder
  • Added a new File command to Move a Collection to a new location
  • Added general support for a Web Collection, which has its Notes stored in a subfolder named notes
  • Added a Transform command to Browse a Web Index

entry.title: Notenik 4.8.0 Released

summary.p: All about the latest improvements to my Mac note-taking app.

entry.content:
• Added support for a 'Launch at Startup' tag that will can be used to launch a bunch of websites when Notenik starts up for the first time in the day.
  • When choosing a font to be used for the Display of Notes, the user may now select a checkbox to allow selection from a longer list of all fonts available on the system.
  • Added a Command to toggle the display of the list of Notes on the left, should one want to focus more on the display for a single Note.
  • Updated the Notenik app icon for consistency with the Big Sur 'squircles'.
  • Made a couple of other adjustments for better appearance on Big Sur.

entry.title: Notenik 4.7.0 Released

summary.p: All about the latest improvements to Mac note-taking app.

entry.content:
• Added support for MultiMarkdown-style citations.
  • Fixed a bug in inline Footnote generation (added in the previous release)
  • Fixed a crashing bug in the export logic.

entry.title: Notenik 4.6.0 Released

summary.p: All about the latest improvements to Mac note-taking app.

entry.content:
Added Markdown parser support for footnotes, a common extension to the original Markdown spec.

Also added a Share option that will format a Note as an HTML blockquote.

Plus there's a new Collection Pref that allows Note Titles to be formatted using level 1 Headings on the Display tab.

Finally, added a Navigation Board to allow easy navigation to known Collections that can be readily accessed by Notenik without any additional user authorization.

Oh, and one more thing… wrote a new Notenik blog post summarizing Notenik improvements made over the last six months.

entry.title: Moved Practopian website to Drupal 8

summary.p: Practopian.org now takes you to a website hosted on Pantheon, built using Drupal 8.

entry.content: Practopian.org now takes you to a website hosted on Pantheon, built using Drupal 8. The menu navigation is improved, and the overall look has changed a bit.

entry.title: Social Distancing and our Essential Nature

summary.p: Social distancing and wearing of face masks have become the new normal for most of us, thanks to the continued threat of COVID-19. And yet, as ever more people work from home, and more students attempt remote learning, I'm concerned about a growing chorus of folks who are celebrating this enforced distancing as a welcome wave of the future, and suggesting that what started as a temporary fix should be embraced as a permanent fixture of 21st century society.

entry.title: The Era of Environmental Accommodation is Over

summary.p: When historians look at the long span of our human history, they try to make sense of our arc of cultural evolution by breaking it up into phases: the agrarian era, the industrial era, the digital era, and so forth.
But of course, there are multiple perspectives we can use for this sort of exercise.
Perhaps the most important perspective to consider is the relationship of our human population to the rest of our world.

entry.title: Undoing Trumpism

summary.p: Many of the things that our current president came to stand for were around before his candidacy – and, in fact, helped him to get elected – and they won't simply vanish on their own. If we're foolish enough to think they will, then we're engaging in as much magical thinking as The Donald is when he claims that COVID-19 will simply disappear all by itself.
